text:
Q: What to do to run a .NET 8.0 executable standalone? A:

While you can run a publish command to generate a self-contained application on Windows, you don't need to do that if you're fine with a framework-dependent application. All you need to do is make sure that the correct runtime is installed. For a Winforms or WPF app, it needs to be at least the desktop runtime, but I personally prefer to install the full SDK, in particular on development systems.

Since you're targeting .NET 8.0, you need a 8.0 runtime. Open a command shell and enter dotnet --info. You get a bunch of information about installed runtimes and their versions. For your Winforms and WPF applications to work, you need to have the following lines in the output:

Microsoft.NETCore.App 8.0.22 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]
Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App 8.0.22 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App]

(The minor version can vary slightly)

If any of these lines is missing (e.g. only lines with major version 9 shown), you didn't install the correct .NET 8.0 runtime.

Q: Browser Caching IIS7 A:

Does Jeff's answer in this question help?

IIS7 Cache-Control

Q: How do I find the date a video (.AVI .MP4) was actually recorded? A:

It depends on the container format, on the camera that recorded the video and maybe on the program used to rewrap or re-encode the video if that was the case. So you may have to try different tools to see if they show you the date you are looking for.

First try MediaInfo. It may show a "Recorded date" and/or an "Encoded date"

Then you could also try ExifTool, a command-line tool. The following command will show you all times that exiftool finds in the files in the current folder. (The command is for Linux or Mac Terminal)

for f in *; do echo "$f"; exiftool -args -time:all "$f"; echo; done

Output example with a DVCAM (.dv) and the re-wrapped .mov file which has lost the recording time:

M00008.dv
-FileModifyDate=2025:12:22 13:01:34+01:00
-FileAccessDate=2025:12:27 15:54:54+01:00
-FileInodeChangeDate=2025:12:23 20:49:30+01:00
-DateTimeOriginal=2004:01:30 18:39:48

M00008.mov
-FileModifyDate=2025:12:22 13:07:50+01:00
-FileAccessDate=2025:12:27 15:55:47+01:00
-FileInodeChangeDate=2025:12:23 20:49:31+01:00
-CreateDate=0000:00:00 00:00:00
-ModifyDate=0000:00:00 00:00:00
-TrackCreateDate=0000:00:00 00:00:00
-TrackModifyDate=0000:00:00 00:00:00
-MediaCreateDate=0000:00:00 00:00:00
-MediaModifyDate=0000:00:00 00:00:00
